title: Word Worlds
client: Local Projects, Planet Word
description: Word Worlds is an interactive exhibit which invites visitors to 'paint' with words, revealing their transformative, multilayered meanings. Using a custom electronic brush, they can dip into buckets of paint describing different semantics like Verdant, Hibernal, Crepuscular and Tempestuous. Then, they can paint with these words on projection-mapped walls and watch their environment and its contents transform before their eyes. I worked alongside a team of designers to conceptualize this project, then spearheaded its software production. Content-, graphics-, and hardware-heavy, the application was built entirely in C++ (OpenFrameworks) and utilized embedded HTC Vive hardware to provide realtime sensor data. The content consisted of 36 12k pre-rendered backdrops layered using GLSL and scores of interchangeable animation sequences, responsively rendered using pixel buffer-based state machines. This is one of many galleries in Planet Word, a museum in Washington, D.C. exploring the expressive power of language.
